section.heading: Tax appeals. Definition. Appointment of judges to hear tax appeals by Chief Court Administrator

content.p: Except as otherwise provided by statute, “tax appeal” means an appeal from an order, decision, determination or disallowance of the Commissioner of Revenue Services; an appeal that may be taken from a decree of a court of probate under subsection

of section12-395; an appeal from any order, decision, determination or disallowance of the Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management pursuant to sections12-242ggto12-242nn, inclusive; and an appeal that may be taken from a decision of the Penalty Review Committee under subsection

subsection.heading: The Chief Court Administrator shall appoint two judges of the Superior Court to hear tax appeals

content.p: If practicable, the judges shall hear the appeals for not less than eighteen months. The appeals may be heard at the judicial district that the Chief Court Administrator deems appropriate.

The Chief Court Administrator shall adopt the policies and procedures necessary to implement the provisions of this section. See Sec. 8-132 re referral of application re statement of compensation to a judge appointed to hear tax appeals.
